column4: the main poblem fo a novice code contributor is imho that it takes hours to find the right file/line to do a small bug fix

CloudMonkee: there's also the Ubuntu Reviewers team. the team exists to go through existing patches attached bugs (1800-2000) and review the patch for 1) being able to apply 2) correctness 3) regression potential, then forward them upstream if they're good. if you can read & understand a bit of code, you could be very helpful there
CloudMonkee: if you're interested in the patch reviewing team, join #ubuntu-reviews
